meanings.definition: A person who believes in monism, the doctrine that only one supreme being exists.
meanings.sent1: Monists appreciate the idea of one all-powerful being.
meanings.sent2: The monists in the group discussed their belief in a single supreme being.
meanings.sent3: The monists at the party debated whether the universe was like a giant puzzle with one piece.
meanings.sent4: In the world of ideas, monists see the supreme being as the sun, illuminating all.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monists can be as simple as a single drop of water in a vast ocean.

meanings.definition: Plural form of monist, referring to a group of individuals who adhere to monism.
meanings.sent1: The monists gathered to discuss their shared belief in one supreme being.
meanings.sent2: Monists from different backgrounds came together to explore their common faith.
meanings.sent3: At the convention, the monists joked about forming a 'one and only' club.
meanings.sent4: The unity among the monists was like a tightly woven fabric, unbreakable and strong.
meanings.sent5: The bond between monists is akin to a single thread weaving through the fabric of existence.
